intro: Coussapoa tolimensis, commonly known as the Tolima waxplant, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
